page.title: 17Crow Point
page.content: On Octber 26th 1984,- the neck of land known as{Crow Point}was partly washed away. There is a difference of opinion as to why this happened. Some local people say it was because of gravel extraction others believe it was due to natural forces. Braunton Conservation Project received a grant to rebuild the point. Tonnes and tonnes of concrete blocks and sand have been shifted by J.C.B's and bulldozers to bridge the gap caused by the surge tide. When we visited the point Mr Harding explained how volunteers and Manpower Services Commission would plant marram grass to cover the repaired area. The marram grass should eventually bind the sand together and the point will again blend in with the surrounding scenery.
